intro: Benthamia lycopsoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf benthamia, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Benthamia lycopsoides is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep root systems that help it survive in drought conditions.
